meanings.sent1: She was predestinating her study schedule for the week ahead.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast is predestinating rain for tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be predestinating the perfect time to pounce on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's strict rules predestinated the outcome of the class project.
meanings.sent5: His habit of checking the clock every hour was predestinating his routine.

meanings.definition: Foreordain or predetermine by divine will
meanings.sent1: The ancient prophecy seemed to be predestinating the hero's journey.
meanings.sent2: Many believe that fate predestinates our ultimate destiny.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller jokingly said the cookies were predestinating a surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky were predestinating the future of the young couple.
meanings.sent5: The old legend predestinated the rise of a great leader.
